data.name: ContentHowToolWorks
data.value: The first step is to set up your farm. The farm will contain your fields, and the fields will have the crops and nutrients applied to them. If you have more than one holding, it's best to add a separate farm for each one.

data.name: ContentHowToolWorks2
data.value: You will get better recommendations if you have a recent soil analysis. You will be asked to enter the data from the analysis as you progress through the service.

data.value: It replaces earlier services such as PLANET and MANNER. The service will allow you to import your data from PLANET.

data.name: contentYourData
data.value:
We only gather the data required to provide you with the appropriate recommendations.

This service will never share your data with any other organisations.

In particular, please note that this service does not share data with the Rural Payments Agency or the Environment Agency.

This service was developed in conjunction with ADAS, AHDB and RSK

data.name: lblAboutGetHelpAndFeedback
data.value: The Create a plan for efficient nutrient management service ('this service') is currently in a private beta phase. This means that we are testing this service by invitation only. Some functionality may not work as expected and some features have not yet been developed.

data.name: lblAboutRecommendationGuidenceAdviceContent1
data.value: This service was developed by the Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs (Defra), the Agriculture and Horticulture Development Board (AHDB), ADAS and the RSK group. Nutrient recommendations are derived from RB209 Application Programming Interface (API); RB209 is the intellectual property of AHDB.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNitrogenExceedWarningHeadingEngland
data.value: This application will take you over the maximum application rate for inorganic nitrogen fertiliser to this crop during the closed spreading period

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNitrogenExceedWarningHeadingWales
data.value: This application will take you over the maximum application rate for inorganic nitrogen fertiliser to this crop during the closed spreading period

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNitrogenExceedWarningPara1England
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser on brassica crops between {0} and {1} must not exceed 100kg of nitrogen per hectare and that no more than 50kg of nitrogen per hectare can be applied every 4 weeks, up to the date on which you harvest the crop.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNitrogenExceedWarningPara1Wales
data.value: The Water Resources Regulations state that the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser on brassica crops between {0} and {1} must not exceed 100kg of nitrogen per hectare, and that no more than 50kg of nitrogen per hectare can be applied every 4 weeks, up to the date on which you harvest the crop.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNitrogenExceedWarningPara2England
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Nitrate Vulnerable Zone rules, and you should consider reducing the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNitrogenExceedWarningPara2Wales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider reducing the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNRateExceedWarningHeadingWales
data.value: This application will take you over the maximum application rate for manufactured nitrogen fertiliser to this crop during the closed spreading period

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNRateExceedWarningPara1England
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser to this crop between {0} and {1} must not exceed {2}kg of nitrogen per hectare.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodNRateExceedWarningPara2Wales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider reducing the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser.

data.name: MsgWinterOilseedRapeNRateExceedWarningHeadingWales
data.value: This application will take you over the maximum application rate for inorganic nitrogen fertiliser to this crop during the closed spreading period

data.name: MsgWinterOilseedRapeNRateExceedWarningPara1England
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser on winter oilseed rape between {0} and 31 October must not exceed 30kg of nitrogen per hectare.

data.name: MsgWinterOilseedRapeNRateExceedWarningPara1Wales
data.value: The Water Resources Regulations state that the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser on winter oilseed rape between {0} and 31 October must not exceed 30kg of nitrogen per hectare.

data.name: Msg31OctoberToEndPeriodFertiliserWarningPara2
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Nitrate Vulnerable Zone rules, and you should consider changing your application date.

data.name: Msg31OctoberToEndPeriodFertiliserWarningPara2Wales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider changing your application date.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodFertiliserWarningHeading
data.value: The application date you entered is inside your closed spreading period for applying inorganic nitrogen fertiliser

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodFertiliserWarningPara2
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Nitrate Vulnerable Zone rules, and you should consider applying outside the closed spreading period.

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodFertiliserWarningPara2Wales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider applying outside the closed spreading period. Before spreading fertiliser, a field inspection should be carried out to consider the risk of causing pollution or damage to the soil.

data.name: MsgWinterGrassNRateExceedWarningPara1England
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser on grass between {0} and 31 October must not exceed 80kg of nitrogen per hectare, and that no more than 40kg of nitrogen per hectare can be applied at any one time.

data.name: MsgWinterGrassNRateExceedWarningPara1Wales
data.value: The Water Resources Regulations state that the application rate of inorganic nitrogen fertiliser on grass between {0} and 31 October must not exceed 80kg of nitrogen per hectare, and that no more than 40kg of nitrogen per hectare can be applied at any one time.

data.name: MsgApplicationDateEnteredIsInsideClosedPeriodWales
data.value: The application date you entered is inside your closed spreading period for applying manure with a high readily available nitrogen content

data.name: MsgClosedPeriodWarningPara2Wales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider applying outside the closed spreading period. Before spreading organic manure, a field inspection should be carried out to consider the risk of causing pollution or damage to the soil.

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningHeading
data.value: This application will take you over the maximum application rate for high readily available nitrogen organic manure during your closed spreading period

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningHeadingWales
data.value: This application will take you over the maximum application rate for high readily available nitrogen organic manure during your closed spreading period

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningPara1
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that on organic farms the application rate of high readily available nitrogen manures on this crop type between the start of the closed spreading period and the end of February must not exceed 150kg of total nitrogen per hectare.

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningPara1Brassica
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that on organic farms the application rate of high readily available nitrogen manures on this crop type between the start of the closed spreading period and the end of February must not exceed 150kg of total nitrogen per hectare, and that no more than 50kg of total nitrogen can be applied every 4 weeks.

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningPara1Grass
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that on organic farms the application rate of high readily available nitrogen manures on grass between the start of the closed spreading period and 31 October must not exceed 150kg of total nitrogen per hectare, and that no more than 40kg of total nitrogen can be applied at any one time.

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningPara1Wales
data.value: The Water Resources Regulations state that the application rate of high readily available nitrogen manures on this crop type between the start of the closed spreading period and the end of February must not exceed 150kg per hectare.

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningPara1WinterOilseed
data.value: The Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules state that on organic farms the application rate of high readily available nitrogen manures on winter oilseed rape between the start of the closed spreading period and 31 October must not exceed 150kg of total nitrogen per hectare.

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningPara2
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Nitrate Vulnerable Zone rules, and you should consider reducing the application rate of high readily available nitrogen manures.

data.name: MsgStartClosedPeriodEndFebWarningPara2Wales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider reducing the application rate of high readily available nitrogen organic manure.

data.name: MsgCropNmaxLimitWarningPara2Wales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider reducing the amount of crop available nitrogen from inorganic fertilisers and organic manures you apply.

data.name: MsgIfOrganicManureNMaxLimitExceedAdditionalWales
data.value: It is an offence to breach the Water Resources Regulations, and you should consider reducing the amount of nitrogen from organic manures.

data.name: lblAboutGetHelpAndFeedback_line2
data.value: Check the release schedule to see what features have been added to the test version of the service.

data.name: lblAboutGetHelpAndFeedback_line3
data.value: View the terms of use for this service.

data.name: lblAboutRecommendationGuidenceAdviceContent3
data.value: Users are responsible for the accuracy of their own data and the application of guidance provided. This service should not be relied upon as the sole source of nutrient management guidance. Always consider local conditions and, if necessary, consult a FACTS Qualified Adviser before making nutrient management decisions.

data.name: lblAbout_this_service_line1
data.value: The first step is to set up your farm. The farm will contain your fields, and the fields will have the crops and nutrients applied to them. If you have more than one holding, it's best to add a separate farm for each one.

data.name: lblAbout_this_service_line2
data.value: The service will warn you of possible breaches of the Nitrate Vulnerable Zone (NVZ) rules as you make your plans.

data.name: lblAbout_this_service_line3
data.value: The service also accounts for Soil Nitrogen Supply (SNS). You can add SNS data for a field at the end of the planning process.

data.name: lblDo_not_show_this_information_again
data.value: Do not show this information again

data.name: lblEnglandFormingRuleOfWater
data.value: England: Farming rules for water and Nitrogen vulnerable zones (NVZs)

data.name: lblHelp_with_the_service_recommendations_line1
data.value: You can email the helpdesk if you have any issues with the data and recommendations the service provides. Email: helpdesk@rsk-bsl.co.uk.

data.name: lblHelp_with_the_service_recommendations_line2
data.value: This service might give slightly different recommendations from the previous service PLANET. This is because this new service uses an updated version of the RB209 API, so it provides the very latest data.

data.name: lblHelp_with_the_service_recommendations_line3
data.value: We will reply to your email as quickly as we can.

data.name: lblIagree_to_the_terms_of_use
data.value: I agree to the terms of use

data.name: lblMore_information_line1
data.value: The Nutrient Management Plan is intended to be used alongside RB209

data.name: lblMore_information_line2
data.value: For advice about nutrient planning in general, start with Tried and Tested (opens in a new window).

data.name: lblMore_information_line3
data.value: For more information on RB209, visit Nutrient management guide (RB209) section 1 (opens in a new window).

data.name: lblPrivate_beta_disclaimer_sub_heading
data.value: Any recommendations and advice given in the private beta version of this service cannot be used:

data.name: lblPrivate_beta_disclaimer_sub_heading_line1
data.value: to demonstrate compliance with any regulation or legislation, such as NVZ rules

data.name: lblPrivate_beta_disclaimer_sub_heading_line2
data.value: as evidence for any government scheme, such as the Sustainable Farming Incentive (SFI)

data.name: lblSaving_your_data_line1
data.value: The service will save the data you input regularly. There will be a Check Your Answers page at the end of each section, and when you select Submit here, your data will be saved up to this point. You will then be able to leave and resume here.

data.name: lblScotlandFormingRuleOfWater
data.value: Scotland: The Action Programme for Nitrate Vulnerable Zones (Scotland) Regulations 2008

data.name: lblSoil_Analysis_line1
data.value: You will get better recommendations if you have a recent soil analysis. You will be asked to enter the data from the analysis as you progress through the service, in order to create your nutrient management plan.

data.name: lblSoil_Analysis_line2
data.value: You should sample the soil from your fields every 3 to 4 years and get it tested for pH, phosphorus, potassium and magnesium.

data.name: lblSoil_Analysis_line3
data.value: If you do not enter a soil analysis, or if your most recent soil analysis is more than 5 years old, any recommendations we give will be based on the target soil pH and nutrient indices for your crop, which may not be accurate for your soil or crop.

data.name: lblWalesFormingRuleOfWater
data.value: Wales: The Water Resources (Control of Agricultural Pollution) (Wales) Regulations 2021

data.name: lblSourceRb209
data.value: Crop need is calculated using AHDB Nutrient Management Guide (RB209). Supply from manures calculated using MANNER-NPK (Nutrient Calculation Engine).
